notes: Default men’s format: Best of 3 sets, standard 7-point tiebreak at 6–6 in all sets with advantage scoring.
Default women’s format: Best of 3 sets, standard 7-point tiebreak at 6–6 in all sets with advantage scoring.
Used best-of-5 with 7-point tiebreak at 6–6 in all sets until 2018.
Switched to 10-point super tiebreak in the final set starting in 2019.
Standard best-of-3 format with 7-point tiebreak at 6–6.
Final was best-of-5 sets through 2007.
Changed to best-of-3 format starting in 2008.
Played best-of-5 with no final-set tiebreak (advantage set) until 2015.
Introduced final-set tiebreak (7 points) between 2016 and 2018.
Switched to best-of-3 format in 2019.
Used advantage sets with no final-set tiebreak until 2021.
Adopted 10-point super tiebreak in the final set starting 2022.
Used advantage sets with no final-set tiebreak until 2021.
Adopted standard 7-point tiebreak at 6–6 starting 2022.
Best-of-3 sets; third set replaced by 10-point match tiebreak; no-ad scoring.
Fast4-style scoring: sets to 4 games, tiebreak at 3–3, and no-ad scoring.
Played best-of-5 with no final-set tiebreak until 2012.
Standardized to best-of-3 with 7-point tiebreaks in 2016.
Best-of-3 singles format aligned with ATP Tour rules.
Best-of-3 singles format aligned with WTA Tour rules.
Best-of-5 with 7-point tiebreak at 6–6 since 1970; first major to use tiebreaks.
Best-of-3 with 7-point tiebreak at 6–6 since 1970; first major to use tiebreaks.
Played advantage sets in the final set (no tiebreak) until 2018.
Used 7-point tiebreak only at 12–12 in the final set from 2019 to 2021.
Unified rule in 2022: 10-point tiebreak at 6–6 in the final set.
Played advantage sets in the final set (no tiebreak) until 2018.
Used 7-point tiebreak only at 12–12 in the final set from 2019 to 2021.
Switched to standard 7-point tiebreak at 6–6 starting 2022.
